articles.title: About this blog
articles.description: Just sharing some small projects and other stuff I've been doing.
articles.contents:
I love learning and using R and RStudio to wrangle, analyse, model, and visualise data.
In fact, this website was created using the distill package in R. RStudio has all the tools
I need to create RMarkdown files and push them through to GitHub. I am indebted to
Yury Zablotski for this video on YouTube,
explaining how to create a blog using the distill package
and Assoc Prof Alison Hill for this blog post
showing how to integrate postcards with distill.
My main online resource for learning R is DataCamp, although recently I have been spending most of my “R time” on YouTube either watching the Statistics Globe channel or
R Programming 101.
I am a big fan of Brandon Foltz on YouTube who is great at explaining statistical concepts step-by-step.
Lately, I have been getting right into Power BI and I am planning to gain my PL-300 Certification (Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst) in 2023.
The easiest way to contact me is probably via Twitter.
My Twitter handle is @mikejhudson.
I hope you find these posts interesting. If you’d like to, you can buy me a coffee.
This page last updated: 2022-09-24

            Hello and welcome to my blog.
            I am an enthusiastic learner and user of R, Python, Power
            BI and Excel, living in the Western Plains of NSW. My
            interests include Japanese, chess, mathematics, reading and
            watching movies from the 1950s & 60s, particularly
            Japanese and Italian films.
            Bachelor of Business Studies at Charles Sturt University
            (Completed 2021)
            Bachelor of Data Analytics at University of South
            Australia (Commenced 2022)
            This page last updated: 2022-12-18
